abstract.p: Sept 29 article about Yasir Arafat's speech at United Nations omitted passage in quotation

block.p: Because of an editing error, an article yesterday about Yasir Arafat's speech at the United Nations omitted a passage in a quotation. The quotation should have said: ''I would like to call upon all of you, from this place, the source of international legitimacy and peacemaking, the guardian of freedom, security and stability, and the source for the achievement of justice and prosperity for humankind, to stand by our people, especially as the five-year transitional period provided for in the Palestinian-Israeli agreements will end on 4 May 1999 and our people demand of us to shoulder our responsibilities, and they wait the establishment of their independent state.''

Because of an editing error, an article yesterday about Yasir Arafat's speech at the United Nations omitted a passage in a quotation. The quotation should have said: ''I would like to call upon all of you, from this place, the source of international legitimacy and peacemaking, the guardian of freedom, security and stability, and the source for the achievement of justice and prosperity for humankind, to stand by our people, especially as the five-year transitional period provided for in the Palestinian-Israeli agreements will end on 4 May 1999 and our people demand of us to shoulder our responsibilities, and they wait the establishment of their independent state.''
